column26: APPROACH OF WINTER   The half stripped trees   struck by a wind together,   bending all,   the leaves flutter drily   and refuse to let go   or driven like hail   stream bitterly out to one side   and fall   where the salvias, hard carmine,--   like no leaf that ever was--   edge the bare garden.
